Transcription-Unit.comment: J. Oberto in 2010 identified a possible binding site for NagC, ATTTATTGGCGGCACAAAATAAA, in the intergenic region of the divergent genes tdk and hns. This demonstration was based on different statistical methods [Oberto10], but it is not known if NagC regulates transcription in both directions.

Publication.title: Nucleotide sequence of the Escherichia coli thymidine kinase gene provides evidence for conservation of functional domains and quaternary structure.
Publication.author: Black ME
Hruby DE

Evidence-Code.common-name: Automated inference that a single-gene directon is a transcription unit
Evidence-Code.comment: Automated inference of transcription unit based on single-gene directon. Existence of a single-gene transcription unit for gene G is inferred computationally by the existence of upstream and downstream genes transcribed in the opposite direction of G.
The length of the (transcribed) RNA is experimentally determined. The length of the mRNA is compared with that of the DNA sequence and by this means the number of genes transcribed are established.
